<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/shiba-inu-s-epic-rally-unseats-dogecoin-puts-robinhood-on-notice?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The New Lord of Dogetown
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/shiba-inu-s-epic-rally-unseats-dogecoin-puts-robinhood-on-notice?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A Shiba Inu dog on a rocket " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/d25cce6621ccdf56ed0ec8c2fd87b7a487cc76fa-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the doge-eat-doge world of meme coins, there’s a new alpha.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thanks to a parabolic rally over the past few weeks, shiba inu coin has <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/27/meme-token-shiba-inu-hits-record-high-closing-in-on-dogecoin.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">leapfrogged dogecoin</a> to become the ninth-most valuable crypto in the world. It’s gained nearly 1,000% in the last month and soared more than 900,000,000% in the past year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The origin story: </strong>While it comes from the same litter, shiba inu wants you to know it’s definitely not like dogecoin. Founded in 2020 as an “experiment in decentralized spontaneous community building,” it’s actually been promoted as the “dogecoin killer.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Shiba inu has some semblance of a community. It’s sold NFTs (called “shiboshis”), and Ethereum creator Vitalik Buterin sent 50 trillion of the coins to aid Covid relief in India earlier this year. </span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This all may seem ridiculous—and it certainly is—but for some companies, meme coins are serious business.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Companies like Robinhood</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Tuesday, the investing platform reported quarterly revenue that came in <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-26/robinhood-crypto-trading-craters-as-revenue-misses-estimates?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wayyy below estimates</a> due primarily to a slowdown in crypto trading—an activity that has played an increasingly outsized role in the company’s sales.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Crypto accounted for more than 50% of Robinhood’s transaction-based revenue in Q2, and dogecoin made up 62% of all crypto revenue.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But as dogecoin was put on a leash last quarter (it’s down 67% from its peak in May), Robinhood’s crypto revenue followed suit—plunging 78%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Will Robinhood embrace dogecoin’s better-trained sibling? Not imminently. While CEO Vlad Tenev acknowledged that “our customers want new coins,” he said “we’re going to be very careful” about adding new tokens given heightened scrutiny from regulators. The company offers seven coins for trading, compared to Coinbase’s 50+.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Robinhood wants to be deliberate, but investors are getting antsy. The company’s stock fell 10% yesterday to close below its IPO price.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">PS: </strong>Is this the <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1453445533754855433?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best individual trade</a> of all time?—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/cigarette-sales-rose-for-the-first-time-in-20-years?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A 20-Year Trend Goes Up In Smoke
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cigarette sales rose last year for <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/27/business/cigarette-sales-rise-pandemic/index.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the first time</a> in two decades, according to the Federal Trade Commission. 8 million more cigarettes were sold in 2020 compared to 2019, a 0.4% bump.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Smoking rates have steadily fallen since 2000, which experts attribute to tobacco taxes, antismoking legislation, and programs that help users quit. But none of those were a match for the stress, anxiety, and boredom of the pandemic’s first calendar year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, as Marlboro owner Altria noted early last year, users had more disposable income available—from not commuting or having a social life outside of Discord—and were using it <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/10/27/1049638567/cigarette-sales-increase-smoking-pandemic?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to make</a> bulk “pantry-loading” purchases.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sales of smokeless tobacco and alcohol also increased last year, showing that all the vices were more popular in 2020.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>like dalgona coffee, cigarettes’ comeback could just be a pandemic blip. In the four weeks leading up to Oct. 9, cigarette sales were down 9.4% relative to the same period last year, according to Nielsen.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FASHION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/rent-the-runway-s-ipo-brings-in-usd357-million-in-new-funding?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fund the Runway
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/rent-the-runway-s-ipo-brings-in-usd357-million-in-new-funding?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="People walk past the Rent the Runway store on October 22, 2021 in New York City." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/4676d6f3070ec4662a459235b7b0d05b03dae6f1-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Rent the Runway, the clothing service that lets you rent outfits from designer brands, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/27/rent-the-runway-ipo-rent-to-start-trading-on-nasdaq-.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went public</a> yesterday. Despite the fact that its entire business model hinges on the worst part of online shopping—returning everything—it nabbed a valuation of more than $1.7 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">RTR’s stock closed 8% lower on the day, and it’s not entirely surprising that its public markets debut was wobbly: The company reported $85 million in net losses on $80 million in revenue in the six months ended July 31.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Growth was a challenge during the pandemic, as lockdowns kept everyone in their PJs. From 2019 to 2020, RTR's active subscribers fell hard from 133,000 to roughly 55,000 (but that's rebounded to 112,000 as of September.)</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Rent the Runway is a leader in a <a href="https://www.axios.com/thrift-market-growth-annual-ee78deec-3521-48c8-a215-2fef871f8dcd.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$40 billion used-clothes industry</a> that's growing more than 15% each year. But while the service might be a smart option for those looking to bypass spending $250 on an Anthro cocktail dress for a wedding they don’t even want to go to, RTR still has lots to prove.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/key-performance-indicators-october-28?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Despite having the highest poverty rates in the country, Louisiana and Mississippi also have the <a href="https://twitter.com/aaronAcarr/status/1453116415280656390?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lowest rates</a> of homelessness. It shows that the “primary factor” contributing to homelessness is housing costs, according to Aaron Carr, the executive director of the nonprofit Housing Rights Initiative.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I don’t know if it’s quite a Sputnik moment, but I think it’s very close to that.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">General Mark Milley, the chairman of the US Joint Chiefs of Staff, said in a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-27/milley-likens-china-s-hypersonic-weapon-test-to-sputnik-moment?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg interview</a> that China’s launch of an advanced hypersonic weapon this summer was a very significant technological event that “has all of our attention.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Are we on the verge of chatting with whales? Thanks to AI, maybe. (<a href="https://www.hakaimagazine.com/features/are-we-on-the-verge-of-chatting-with-whales/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Hakai Magazine</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/a-and-w-fixes-its-biggest-marketing-fail?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Do Not Read If Fractions Upset You
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/a-and-w-fixes-its-biggest-marketing-fail?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A&W's 3/9 Burger" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f3d0a6c0d38683bb313c0e985f39f6e72d5a089e-7952x4472.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>A&W</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Are you smarter than a second grader? A&W found out in the ’80s that most folks weren’t, when it launched a 1/3-pound burger to one-up McDonald’s Quarter Pounder at the same price point. What happened? People didn’t realize 1/3 > 1/4, and the burger didn’t sell well enough to stay on the menu.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">40 years later, the fast-food chain is fixing one of the most famous marketing goofs of all time with the debut of a “3/9 Burger,” betting that bigger numbers will lead to <a href="https://thetakeout.com/new-aw-burger-bigger-than-quarter-pounder-math-fail-1847927720?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">better sales</a> and won’t invite the wrath of math teachers everywhere.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why now?</strong> Liz Bazner, A&W’s director of marketing, explained that the 1/3 Burger has been haunting the brand for years, a ghost story that gets retold on social media every few months. Most recently, a “<a href="https://www.instagram.com/reel/CNxrh0EniSu/?utm_source=ig_embed&ig_rid=3990744d-76c5-44a4-8233-c75a07c957f2" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest marketing fails</a>” Instagram video about A&W’s darkest chapter went viral.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The fast-food brand is finally ready to set the record straight. The 3/9 Burger is available now, and you can watch its promotional video <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EMNqJQaf08E" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>All press is good press and, in this case, A&W is getting a social media boost from this juicy story.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
The Man Behind Home Depot's 12-Foot-Tall Skeleton

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mickey McDougall, Home Depot, Getty Images/selamiozalp, Getty Images/Creative Thinking</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When it became clear that the pandemic would be ruining Halloween 2020, <em>he</em> arrived to save us with his sparkling blue eyes and bare femurs. Home Depot’s 12-foot-tall skeleton, known to friends as Skelly, went viral last year and sold out before October even started. This year, Skelly’s back...well, not really—he sold out again.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We talked to Lance Allen, the decorative holiday merchant director for Home Depot, aka Skelly’s dad, about the big bone man’s journey from a whiteboard in a conference room to the ultimate Twitter himbo.</p>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/the-man-behind-home-depot-s-12-foot-tall-skeleton?utm_campaign=mb&utm_content=nl_button&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="customizableButton" target="_blank" style="background-color:#1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;font-weight:700;padding:12px 16px;border-radius:4px;color:white;display:inline-block;margin-bottom:15px">Read the full interview here</a>
</div>

WHAT ELSE IS BREWING
</h3>

<span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/10/27/1049530975/ncaa-spends-more-on-mens-sports-report-reveals?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The NCAA</a></span><span> spends more on men’s sports than on women’s sports, a law firm hired to investigate gender disparities in college athletics found.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><a href="https://www.axios.com/state-department-first-passport-x-gender-marker-2fdeec45-6728-45b5-8b07-52be6264662f.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The US State Department</a></span><span> issued its first passport with an “X” gender marker in a move to recognize people who identify as nonbinary, intersex, and gender-nonconforming.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/27/uber-will-offer-up-to-50000-teslas-to-its-drivers-through-hertz-deal.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Hertz</a></span><span>, fresh off its purchase of 100,000 Teslas, will offer 50,000 of those electric vehicles as rentals to Uber drivers.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-lifestyle-holidays-prices-national-retail-federation-27a0a75e14460eca9744a78fb60fb4e9?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Holiday sales</a></span><span> in the US could boom as much as 10.5% over last year, according to a forecast by the National Retail Federation.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Puzzle Section
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>Round out this dog-themed newsletter by playing today's Mini, called "Canine Command." <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/brew-mini-canine-command?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Solve it here</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three headlines and a lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than anyone who said <em>Dune</em> was boring. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Hiker lost for 24 hours </span><span><a href="https://nypost.com/2021/10/25/hiker-lost-for-24-hours-ignored-calls-from-rescuers-because-of-unknown-number/?utm_medium=SocialFlow&utm_campaign=SocialFlow&utm_source=NYPTwitter" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ignored</a></span><span> calls from rescuers because of unknown number</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A man </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2021/10/24/pokemon-card-fraud-case-covid-relief/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spent</a></span><span> most of his Covid business loan on one item, prosecutors say: A $57,789 Pokémon card</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe New Lord of Dogetown \n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A Shiba Inu dog on a rocket \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/d25cce6621ccdf56ed0ec8c2fd87b7a487cc76fa-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the doge-eat-doge world of meme coins, there’s a new alpha.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThanks to a parabolic rally over the past few weeks, shiba inu coin has \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/27/meme-token-shiba-inu-hits-record-high-closing-in-on-dogecoin.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eleapfrogged dogecoin\u003c/a\u003e to become the ninth-most valuable crypto in the world. It’s gained nearly 1,000% in the last month and soared more than 900,000,000% in the past year. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe origin story: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile it comes from the same litter, shiba inu wants you to know it’s definitely not like dogecoin. Founded in 2020 as an “experiment in decentralized spontaneous community building,” it’s actually been promoted as the “dogecoin killer.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShiba inu has some semblance of a community. It’s sold NFTs (called “shiboshis”), and Ethereum creator Vitalik Buterin sent 50 trillion of the coins to aid Covid relief in India earlier this year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis all may seem ridiculous—and it certainly is—but for some companies, meme coins are serious business.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCompanies like Robinhood\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Tuesday, the investing platform reported quarterly revenue that came in \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-26/robinhood-crypto-trading-craters-as-revenue-misses-estimates?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewayyy below estimates\u003c/a\u003e due primarily to a slowdown in crypto trading—an activity that has played an increasingly outsized role in the company’s sales.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCrypto accounted for more than 50% of Robinhood’s transaction-based revenue in Q2, and dogecoin made up 62% of all crypto revenue.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut as dogecoin was put on a leash last quarter (it’s down 67% from its peak in May), Robinhood’s crypto revenue followed suit—plunging 78%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWill Robinhood embrace dogecoin’s better-trained sibling? Not imminently. While CEO Vlad Tenev acknowledged that “our customers want new coins,” he said “we’re going to be very careful” about adding new tokens given heightened scrutiny from regulators. The company offers seven coins for trading, compared to Coinbase’s 50+.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eRobinhood wants to be deliberate, but investors are getting antsy. The company’s stock fell 10% yesterday to close below its IPO price.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePS: \u003c/strong\u003eIs this the \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1453445533754855433?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebest individual trade\u003c/a\u003e of all time?—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS sold in 2020 compared to 2019, a 0.4% bump.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSmoking rates have steadily fallen since 2000, which experts attribute to tobacco taxes, antismoking legislation, and programs that help users quit. But none of those were a match for the stress, anxiety, and boredom of the pandemic’s first calendar year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, as Marlboro owner Altria noted early last year, users had more disposable income available—from not commuting or having a social life outside of Discord—and were using it \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/10/27/1049638567/cigarette-sales-increase-smoking-pandemic?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eto make\u003c/a\u003e bulk “pantry-loading” purchases.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSales of smokeless tobacco and alcohol also increased last year, showing that all the vices were more popular in 2020.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003elike dalgona coffee, cigarettes’ comeback could just be a pandemic blip. In the four weeks leading up to Oct. 9, cigarette sales were down 9.4% relative to the same period last year, according to Despite the fact that its entire business model hinges on the worst part of online shopping—returning everything—it nabbed a valuation of more than $1.7 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRTR’s stock closed 8% lower on the day, and it’s not entirely surprising that its public markets debut was wobbly: The company reported $85 million in net losses on $80 million in revenue in the six months ended July 31.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGrowth was a challenge during the pandemic, as lockdowns kept everyone in their PJs. From 2019 to 2020, RTR's active subscribers fell hard from 133,000 to roughly 55,000 (but that's rebounded to 112,000 as of September.)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Rent the Runway is a leader in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/thrift-market-growth-annual-ee78deec-3521-48c8-a215-2fef871f8dcd.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$40 billion used-clothes industry\u003c/a\u003e that's growing more than 15% each year. But while the service might be a smart option for those looking to bypass spending $250 on an Anthro cocktail dress for a wedding they don’t even want to go to, RTR still has lots to prove.—\u003cem\u003eMM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAre you smarter than a second grader? A\u0026W found out in the ’80s that most folks weren’t, when it launched a 1/3-pound burger to one-up McDonald’s Quarter Pounder at the same price point. What happened? People didn’t realize 1/3 \u003e 1/4, and the burger didn’t sell well enough to stay on the menu.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e40 years later, the fast-food chain is fixing one of the most famous marketing goofs of all time with the debut of a “3/9 Burger,” betting that bigger numbers will lead to \u003ca href=\"https://thetakeout.com/new-aw-burger-bigger-than-quarter-pounder-math-fail-1847927720?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebetter sales\u003c/a\u003e and won’t invite the wrath of math teachers everywhere.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy now?\u003c/strong\u003e Liz Bazner, A\u0026W’s director of marketing, explained that the 1/3 Burger has been haunting the brand for years, a ghost story that gets retold on social media every few months. Most recently, a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.instagram.com/reel/CNxrh0EniSu/?utm_source=ig_embed\u0026ig_rid=3990744d-76c5-44a4-8233-c75a07c957f2\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest marketing fails\u003c/a\u003e” Instagram video about A\u0026W’s darkest chapter went viral.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe fast-food brand is finally ready to set the record straight. The 3/9 Burger is available now, and you can watch its promotional video \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EMNqJQaf08E\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAll press is good press and, in this case, A\u0026W is getting a social media boost from this juicy story.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/a-and-w-fixes-its-biggest-marketing-fail\u0026utm_source=facebook_share\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
